entry.title: East Flanders swimming facilities needs to allow burkinis, says Flemish Human Rights Institute
entry.content:
East Flanders swimming facilities needs to allow burkinis, says Flemish Human Rights Institute

Women wearing burkinis should be allowed in swimming facilities in East Flanders, the Flemish Human Rights Institute’s Dispute Chamber rules.

Tuesday, 1 October 2024

entry.title: Damage detected to the concrete casing above the Doel 4 nuclear reactor
entry.content:
Damage detected to the concrete casing above the Doel 4 nuclear reactor

Inspectors have identified damage to the reinforcement of the concrete on the outer casing of Doel 4 nuclear reactor, Engie reports.

entry.title: Beerschot fined €50,000 after abandoning match against Antwerp
entry.content:
Beerschot fined €50,000 after abandoning match against Antwerp

A €50,000 fine is imposed on Beerschot for abandoning a match against Antwerp on Sunday in the Jupiler Pro League. The Royal Belgian Football Association (KBVB) also confirmed a 5-0 forfeit loss for Beerschot.

entry.title: Belgium's government not accountable for the statements by foreign heads
entry.content:
Belgium's government not accountable for the statements by foreign heads

The Belgian Government distances itself from much-criticised remarks about womanhood and abortion made over the weekend by Pope Francis.

entry.title: Make meningitis B vaccine available to all Belgium's children, paediatricians urge
entry.content:
Make meningitis B vaccine available to all Belgium's children, paediatricians urge

Belgian Paediatric Society, SBP, urges the authorities to ensure equal access to meningitis B vaccination for all children.

entry.title: Brussels-North police now require online appointments for non-urgent complaints
entry.content:
Brussels-North police now require online appointments for non-urgent complaints

Anyone wishing to file a complaint with Brussels North Police for a non-urgent matter now needs to make an online appointment via www.polbruno.be.

entry.title: Tata Steel closes its last blast furnace in the UK
entry.content:
Tata Steel closes its last blast furnace in the UK

Tata Steel is shutting down its last blast furnace in the United Kingdom on Monday, a move that will cost up to 2,800 jobs.

entry.content:

entry.content:

entry.content:

entry.content:

entry.title: Bpost will no longer leave parcel delivery notes in letterboxes
entry.content:

This measure will save 394 tonnes of CO2 and 302 tonnes of paper annually, reducing paper volume by 97%.

entry.title: Pogacar crowned World Champion after a perfect season, Evenepoel 5th
entry.content:
Pogacar crowned World Champion after a perfect season, Evenepoel 5th

The 26-year-old Slovenian became the third rider to achieve the Triple Crown (Tour de France, Giro, World Championships) after Eddy Merckx in 1974 and Stephen Roche in 1987.

entry.content:

entry.title: No further cost-cutting at VRT after years on a tight budget
entry.content:

entry.title: Belgium's Olympic hero Evenepoel faces 'royal showdown' in Zurich World Championships
entry.content:
Belgium's Olympic hero Evenepoel faces 'royal showdown' in Zurich World Championships

entry.title: Move by Flemish Government to scrap religion and ethics classes could be 'unconstitutional'
entry.content:
